channel.title: Npc Rebuild Question
channel.description: Okay with the Npc rebuild method how would I execute it? like let's say I had some event going on in my server which gave the boolean 'eventSpawned' a value of true... but I need to rebuild the npc list everytime the event is called... My event calls a method which misc.randoms a couple things, and depending on the outcome of that , different npcs spawn for the different outcomes... so basically what I'm trying to say is... how would I make these npcs from the event disappear once the event is called again, to avoid double spawning(if the event outcome is the same) and to remove event 1's NPCS(example) , because the outcome from the misc.random event called the event 2?(example) ... if you need more explaining just ask:P all help appreciated

item.title: Npc Rebuild Question
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Show some sample code so I can better understand you, but from what I did understand you simply want NPC’s in a specified coordinate to vanish every time a new “wave” (so to speak) is initiated. To do that just create a boolean with the coordinates of the area and if a new wave is called have all entities within that boolean vanish.

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Rebuild Question
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

Okay with the Npc rebuild method how would I execute it? like let’s say I had some event going on in my server which gave the boolean ‘eventSpawned’ a value of true… but I need to rebuild the npc list everytime the event is called… My event calls a method which misc.randoms a couple things, and depending on the outcome of that , different npcs spawn for the different outcomes… so basically what I’m trying to say is… how would I make these npcs from the event disappear once the event is called again, to avoid double spawning(if the event outcome is the same) and to remove event 1’s NPCS(example) , because the outcome from the misc.random event called the event 2?(example) … if you need more explaining just ask:P all help appreciated

Read full topic
